newsitem.title: USA: Sparton to offer auto businesses for sale.
newsitem.headline: Sparton to offer auto businesses for sale.

text.p: Sparton Corp said its board decided to offer the company's automotive businesses for sale at a minimum price of $70 million, subject to shareholder approval.
"Discussions with several interested principals are ongoing," the company said.
Prospective purchasers have not completed due diligence, but Sparton said it expects a further announcement within 60 days.
Shares in the company were unchanged at 6-3/4.

The companies for sale are Sparton Engineered Products-KPI Group and Sparton Engineered Products-Flora Group. Their combined revenues totaled $121.2 million in the fisal year ended June 30, Sparton said. The operations posted an after-tax loss on the fiscal year of $1.2 million.
Total Sparton revenues on the fiscal year, including the two discontinued businesses, were $224 million, compared with $209.5 million in fiscal 1995.

After the sale, Sparton said its business will consist of its electronics and telecommunications operations. Proceeds from the sale will be used to reduce debt and provide capital for expanding the electronics business, Sparton said.
